long_desc.thetext:
If you open a documentation node (e.g. a class), scroll within it, and then change to another class using the tree navigation, the scroll position in the document pane is retained (i.e. if you were in the middle of the node documentation in the first node, you will land in the middle of the node in the second). This is confusing as - depending on the two nodes - the impression can appear that nothing has happened (e.g. if the two nodes have similar properties or methods). It also defies the prinicple of least surprise as it breaks expectations learned when changing pages in a web browser or other browser applications.
The scroll position should be reset on node changes.
(This of course applies only in cases where the navigational link doesn't contain an anchor within the target page.)
